New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in 23 years to reach 400 total bases in a season.
Key Match Events: Walker Buehler started on regular rest for the first time in 22 months and carried his daughter, Finley, around the empty field in the aftermath of the game.
Will Smith hit a game-tying homer in the seventh inning.
Mookie Betts singled in his first at-bat off Musgrove and drove a Tanner Scott slider into right field for a two-run single.
Shohei Ohtani became the first player in 23 years to reach 400 total bases in a season.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers, needing to claim a series for the right to celebrate with fans in their own ballpark for the first time since 2018, rattled off a five-run seventh to make it happen.
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts said that winning the division title 'feels a tick sweeter' due to the adversity the team has faced this year.
Freddie Freeman said he will do everything he can to be ready for the NLDS in nine days, despite nursing a sprained ankle.
The Dodgers' manager, Dave Roberts, said that they will 'ride that horse, that thoroughbred, to a championship' in reference to Shohei Ohtani.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers have won the NL West for the 11th time in 12 seasons.
The Padres had been a strong contender for the division title all season, but the Dodgers were able to clinch it with a 7-2 victory.
The game was a significant moment for Shohei Ohtani, who became the first player in 23 years to reach 400 total bases in a season.
